intro: Stachys mollis, commonly known as velvetleaf or woolly betony, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and spikes of violet or blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Stachys mollis is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
